elements.label: Section
elements.description: Distinct parts of a document or website

elements.label: Organization
elements.description: An established entity such as a university or company

elements.label: Page
elements.description: Individual parts of a website or document with rich-text information

elements.label: Article
elements.description: A written piece on a specific topic, providing information or commentary, often published in magazines, newspapers, journals, or blogs.

elements.label: Link
elements.description: Links are group-specific urls crowdsourced from different group chats and events.

elements.label: Book
elements.description: A written work published in physical or digital format.

elements.summary: A small list of people and organizations related to the metacrisis
elements.label: Metacrisis People & Organizations

elements.summary: Technologist, facilitator, and coach trained in the fields of AI/ML, complexity science, and insight meditation
elements.label: Stephen Reid

elements.summary: An "ex-marketing executive" turned self-education entrepreneur after an existential crisis, founder of Sloww.co. His purpose is synthesizing lifelong learning that catalyzes deeper development.
elements.label: KyleÂ Kowalski

elements.summary: "Truth and Love" embodies the principle that honesty and compassion are essential foundations for fostering trust, understanding, and harmony in a more ideal future world.
elements.label: Truth and Love

elements.summary: To achieve a more ideal future world, we must prioritize consuming nutritious, cost-effective, and sustainably produced food to enhance global health and resource efficiency.
elements.label: we must eat healthier, cheaper, more efficient food

elements.summary: The principle "everything we do we can do forever" emphasizes sustainable practices that ensure resources are used responsibly and ecosystems are preserved for future generations.
elements.label: everything we do we can do forever.

elements.summary: Transitioning away from fossil fuels is essential to mitigate climate change, reduce pollution, and promote sustainable energy solutions for a healthier planet.
elements.label: we must phase out fossil fuels

elements.summary: Decentralizing power ensures equitable distribution of authority and resources, while effective coordination among people fosters collaboration and unity towards common goals.
elements.label: power must be decentralized but people must be coordinated

elements.summary: A more ideal future world hinges on aligning incentives with ethical and sustainable practices, motivating individuals and organizations to prioritize long-term societal well-being over short-term gains.
elements.label: A better world requires better incentives.

elements.summary: "Water must be clear" emphasizes the necessity for clean, unpolluted water sources to ensure a healthy ecosystem and sustainable future for all living beings.
elements.label: Water must be clear

elements.summary: "Soil must be fertile to ensure sustainable agriculture, support biodiversity, and maintain ecosystem health for a more ideal future world."
elements.label: Soil must be fertile

elements.summary: Ensuring air is fresh involves reducing pollution, increasing green spaces, and promoting clean energy to improve health and environmental quality.
elements.label: Air must be fresh

elements.summary: Natural systems must operate independently without human interference to maintain ecological balance and ensure sustainability for future generations.
elements.label: Natural systems must be autonomous

elements.summary: "Food must be medicine" emphasizes the importance of consuming nutrient-rich, whole foods to prevent disease, promote health, and enhance overall well-being for a more sustainable and healthier future.
elements.label: Food must be medicine

elements.summary: "Existence must be regenerative" means that all aspects of life and development should contribute to restoring and enhancing the natural environment, ensuring sustainability and resilience for future generations.
elements.label: Existence must be regenerative

elements.summary: A strong faith provides individuals with resilience and hope, fostering a more compassionate and unified society for an ideal future world.
elements.label: Faith must be strong

elements.summary: "Compassion with Truth" involves empathetically understanding others while honestly communicating facts, fostering a future world grounded in kindness and integrity.
elements.label: Compassion with Truth

elements.summary: Cherishing beauty involves recognizing and preserving the aesthetic and intrinsic value in nature, art, and human interactions, fostering a more harmonious and appreciative society.
elements.label: Beauty must be cherished

elements.summary: A kumu.io map of the tensions and synergies between the various "we must" statements
elements.label: Tensions & Synergies Graph

elements.summary: This is a synthesized list of concepts from everyone's boards, answering the question "What must be true?"
elements.label: What Must Be True? Miro Board Concepts

elements.summary: Understanding systems thinking is essential for addressing complex global challenges and creating sustainable solutions for a more ideal future world.
elements.label: we must be educated in systems

elements.summary: "Meaningful design at the core of every discipline ensures that all fields prioritize purpose, sustainability, and human-centered solutions, fostering a more harmonious and progressive future."
elements.label: meaningful design at the core of every discipline

elements.summary: To create a more ideal future world, we must cultivate critical thinking and self-awareness to question our assumptions and biases, ensuring our thoughts align with reality and promote understanding.
elements.label: we must learn how to not believe everything we think

elements.summary: Ensuring a more ideal future world requires that the advantages of automation and technology are equitably shared across all segments of society, reducing inequality and enhancing overall well-being.
elements.label: the benefits of automation and technology must be distributed

elements.summary: To ensure a more ideal future world, we must remain vigilant and proactive in safeguarding shared resources from exploitation, thereby preserving them for the benefit of all.
elements.label: we must always be prepared and ready to defend the commons against those who want to exploit it

elements.summary: "Water must be clear" emphasizes the necessity for clean, unpolluted water sources to ensure a healthy ecosystem and sustainable future for all living beings.
elements.label: Water must be clear

elements.summary: "Soil must be fertile to ensure sustainable agriculture, support biodiversity, and maintain ecosystem health for a more ideal future world."
elements.label: Soil must be fertile

elements.summary: Ensuring air is fresh involves reducing pollution, increasing green spaces, and promoting clean energy to improve health and environmental quality.
elements.label: Air must be fresh

elements.summary: Natural systems must be autonomous to ensure they function independently and sustainably, maintaining ecological balance without human intervention.
elements.label: Natural systems must be autonomous

elements.summary: In an ideal future world, food should be both a source of nourishment and healing, readily available to all, ensuring health and well-being for every individual.
elements.label: Food must be medicine and accessible

elements.summary: The principle "Existence must be regenerative" emphasizes the need for systems and practices that restore, renew, and revitalize natural and human resources, ensuring sustainability and resilience for future generations.
elements.label: Existence must be regenerative

elements.summary: A more ideal future world requires unwavering faith, as it fosters resilience, hope, and the courage to pursue transformative change despite challenges.
elements.label: Faith must be strong

elements.summary: "Compassion with Truth" means approaching every situation with empathy and understanding while remaining committed to honesty and transparency, fostering a more harmonious and just future.
elements.label: Compassion with Truth

elements.summary: Cherishing beauty involves recognizing and preserving the aesthetic and intrinsic value of our surroundings, cultures, and relationships, fostering a more harmonious and enriched future world.
elements.label: Beauty must be cherished

elements.summary: Localizing life support systems ensures resilience and sustainability by reducing dependency on external resources and enhancing community self-sufficiency.
elements.label: Life support systems must be localized

elements.summary: Feedback loops must be tight to ensure rapid response and adaptation, allowing systems to quickly correct errors and optimize performance for a more ideal future world.
elements.label: Feedback loops must be tight

elements.summary: Materials must be designed and selected to harmonize with their surrounding environment, ensuring they do not cause harm or degradation to ecosystems and contribute positively to sustainability.
elements.label: Materials must be compatible with the environment

elements.summary: Education should be seamlessly integrated into everyday life, utilizing real-world contexts and experiences to enhance learning and foster a deeper connection with the environment.
elements.label: Education must be embedded in the environment

elements.summary: Regular discussions of philosophy encourage critical thinking, foster open-mindedness, and promote ethical decision-making, contributing to a more enlightened and harmonious future world.
elements.label: Philosophy must be discussed often

elements.summary: Connecting different generations fosters mutual understanding, knowledge exchange, and collaboration, which are essential for building a more harmonious and progressive future.
elements.label: Different generations must be connected

elements.summary: "Work towards unity" means fostering collaboration and understanding among diverse groups to build a harmonious and inclusive global community.
elements.label: Work towards unity

elements.summary: A more ideal future world requires a vision that is clearly expressed, collectively embraced, and thoughtfully developed to guide and inspire collaborative efforts.
elements.label: we must have a vision that is articulated, socially shared & formulated

elements.summary: Designing systems that are self-regulating ensures they can autonomously adapt and maintain balance in response to changing conditions, promoting sustainability and resilience in a future world.
elements.label: we must design systems that are self-regulating

elements.summary: "Disarming" involves reducing or eliminating weapons to foster global peace and security, creating a more harmonious and cooperative future world.
elements.label: Disarming

elements.summary: Observing involves attentively noticing and understanding the world around us to make informed decisions that contribute to a more ideal future.
elements.label: Observing

elements.summary: Integrating involves harmoniously combining diverse perspectives, resources, and technologies to foster collaboration and innovation for a more sustainable and equitable future.
elements.label: Integrating

elements.summary: "Slowing down" involves embracing a more deliberate pace in daily life to foster mindfulness, reduce stress, and enhance overall well-being, contributing to a more sustainable and balanced future world.
elements.label: Slowing down

elements.summary: "Physical and mental space" refers to the creation of environments that promote well-being and creativity by ensuring individuals have access to both serene physical surroundings and the mental freedom to explore and express their thoughts without constraints.
elements.label: Physical and mental space

elements.summary: "Letting go" involves releasing past grievances and attachments to foster personal growth and collective harmony, paving the way for a more peaceful and progressive future.
elements.label: Letting go

elements.summary: In an ideal future world, food should be straightforward and accessible, allowing individuals to make healthy choices without needing extensive nutritional knowledge.
elements.label: Food needs to be simple/not require an in depth education to navigate for health.

elements.summary: To achieve a more ideal future world, housing must be both accessible and affordable, with larger living spaces designed to accommodate growing populations and diverse family structures.
elements.label: Housing needs to be available and affordable. Housing needs to be bigger to house more people.

elements.summary: Allocating time for rest and enjoyment fosters self-discovery, which in turn encourages actions and societal structures that are more harmonious and aligned with individual and collective well-being.
elements.label: Time must be allotted for rest and enjoyment. This promotes self discovery, leading to more aligned actions, societies and structures.

elements.summary: Overcoming fear requires a connection to the Divine or Higher Self, fostering inner peace and guiding humanity towards a more harmonious and enlightened future.
elements.label: There must be a connection to the Divine or Higher Self to overcome fear.

elements.summary: Economic systems should promote sustainable growth by balancing development with environmental and social constraints to ensure long-term prosperity.
elements.label: The economics needs to support growth, but within limits.

elements.summary: Implementing robust safety nets ensures that individuals have access to essential resources and support, reducing the pressure to merely survive and allowing them to thrive.
elements.label: Safety nets need to be put in place to lessen the need for survival.

elements.summary: A more ideal future world requires that every individual is empowered with the necessary freedom and resources to pursue personal growth, self-discovery, and the realization of their unique potential.
elements.label: Everyone must be given the freedom and resources to explore themselves.

elements.summary: Prioritizing the exploration of other cultures fosters mutual understanding, respect, and collaboration, paving the way for a more harmonious and interconnected global community.
elements.label: Exploring other cultures must be prioritized.

elements.summary: Education should holistically integrate mental, spiritual, physical, and financial health to cultivate well-rounded individuals equipped for a more ideal future world.
elements.label: Mental, spiritual, physical and financial health, but be embedded in education.

elements.summary: Education must be accessible to ensure that every individual, regardless of their socio-economic background, location, or personal circumstances, has the opportunity to learn and develop the skills necessary to thrive in a rapidly changing world.
elements.label: Education must be accessible.

elements.summary: Ensuring clean water and fertile soil is essential for sustaining healthy ecosystems, supporting biodiversity, and securing food and water resources for future generations.
elements.label: Water must be clean. Soil must be fertile.

elements.summary: Embracing love as the core of our existence fosters compassion, unity, and understanding, paving the way for a harmonious and ideal future world.
elements.label: We must return to love as the purpose of our existence

elements.summary: Recognizing the interconnectedness of all living beings and the environment is essential for fostering a harmonious and sustainable future, as our actions towards others and nature ultimately reflect back on ourselves.
elements.label: We must see all living things as united, codependent forces. What I do to others - what I do to nature - I do to myself.

elements.summary: The principle emphasizes the interconnectedness of ecosystems, highlighting that nurturing soil health is fundamental to sustaining robust plants, which in turn support thriving animals and humans, ultimately contributing to a balanced and resilient planet.
elements.label: We must understand that healthy soil = healthy plants = healthy animals = healthy humans = healthy planet

elements.summary: To create a more ideal future world, we must pause to introspect and critically examine the origins and validity of our beliefs and societal systems, discerning whether they stem from inherent nature or learned nurture.
elements.label: We must take the time to slow down and go inward - to question our conventional beliefs and the systems we were born into. Where did this belief come from? Why do I believe it to be true? Was this acquired through nature or nurture?

elements.summary: The principle emphasizes the interconnectedness of ecosystems, highlighting that nurturing soil health leads to thriving plants, which support robust animal and human health, ultimately contributing to a sustainable and balanced planet.
elements.label: We must understand that healthy soil = healthy plants = healthy animals = healthy humans = healthy planet

elements.summary: Re-envisioning power involves harmonizing individual and collective needs to foster equitable and sustainable systems that empower all members of society.
elements.label: Critical and cohesive re-imagining of Power based on both individual and collective needs

elements.summary: Incentive-based systems align with collective well-being by motivating individuals to act in ways that benefit both themselves and the broader community, fostering a more harmonious and prosperous society.
elements.label: incentive based systems align with collective well-being

elements.summary: In a more ideal future world, life support systems must operate free from monetary or profit incentives to ensure equitable access and prioritize the well-being of all individuals over financial gain.
elements.label: money/profit incentives must end within any life support system

elements.summary: Ensuring nervous system regulation across populations involves promoting mental health, reducing stress, and fostering resilience to create a more balanced and harmonious future world.
elements.label: nervous system regulation across pupulations

elements.summary: "Safety for all" ensures that every individual, regardless of their background or circumstances, is protected from harm and has access to secure environments, fostering a more equitable and peaceful future.
elements.label: safety for all

elements.summary: A more ideal future world is built on the foundation that love, when consistently remembered, openly expressed, and generously given without conditions, fosters deeper connections and understanding among all people.
elements.label: Love must be remembered, expressed and given freely.

elements.summary: "Community engagement, shifting from ME to WE, emphasizes collective action and shared responsibility to foster a more inclusive and sustainable future."
elements.label: community engagement- from ME to WE

elements.summary: "Clean water is essential for a more ideal future world, ensuring access to safe, uncontaminated water for all, which supports health, agriculture, and sustainable ecosystems."
elements.label: clean water

elements.summary: A more ideal future world relies on ethical platforms that facilitate the consistent sharing of ideas, visions, knowledge, and resources, fostering collaboration and mutual understanding across diverse communities.
elements.label: Ethical platforms and consistent sharing of ideas, visions, knowledge and resources

elements.summary: A more ideal future world relies on the integration of healthy soil, seeds, agriculture, and food systems to ensure sustainable food production, environmental resilience, and improved human health.
elements.label: healthy soil, seeds, agriculture and food systems

elements.summary: Embracing integration and connectedness with nature involves recognizing our role as stewards of the Earth, fostering sustainable practices that harmonize human activities with the planet's ecosystems to ensure a thriving future for all.
elements.label: integration and connectedness with nature and the planet stewards of mother earth

elements.summary: "HOME represents the harmonious coexistence of humanity and nature, where we nurture and protect our planet as a sacred space, ensuring a sustainable and peaceful future for all."
elements.label: HOMEHeavenOnMotherEarth

elements.summary: A clean and abundant source of energy is essential for a more ideal future world as it ensures sustainable development, reduces environmental impact, and supports economic growth without depleting natural resources.
elements.label: Clean and abundant source of energy

elements.summary: "Collective rather than individual intelligence" emphasizes the importance of harnessing the diverse knowledge and perspectives of groups to solve complex problems and drive innovation for a more equitable and sustainable future.
elements.label: Collective rather than individual intelligence.

elements.summary: "Awakened states of being" involve heightened awareness and consciousness, fostering empathy, understanding, and interconnectedness, essential for creating a more harmonious and ideal future world.
elements.label: Awakened states of being

elements.summary: A positive system of incentives towards human and planetary wellbeing encourages actions and policies that prioritize sustainable development, equitable resource distribution, and the health of both people and the environment.
elements.label: Positive system of incentives towards human and planetary wellbeing

elements.summary: A zero waste society aims to eliminate waste by promoting sustainable production, consumption, and recycling practices, ensuring that all resources are reused or repurposed to minimize environmental impact.
elements.label: Zero waste society

elements.summary: Recognizing our inherent potential and authentic selves is essential for fostering a future world where individuals contribute meaningfully and collaboratively to societal progress.
elements.label: We must remember who we truly are and what we are capable of.

elements.summary: A more ideal future world relies on the principle of "high quality and quantity of interconnection," where seamless and robust networks facilitate global collaboration, communication, and resource sharing, enhancing collective progress and understanding.
elements.label: high quality and quantity of interconnection

elements.summary: A more ideal future world is achieved by ensuring universal access to clean water, nutritious food, unpolluted air, secure shelter, and safety for all individuals.
elements.label: healthy water, food, air; shelter & safety

elements.summary: "Systems that incentivize abundance encourage sustainable practices and equitable resource distribution, fostering innovation and collaboration for a thriving global community."
elements.label: systems that incentivize abundance & what"s right

elements.summary: "Open hearts and minds" embodies the principle of embracing empathy and understanding, fostering a world where diverse perspectives are valued and collaboration leads to collective progress.
elements.label: Open hearts and minds

elements.summary: A more ideal future world is built on the principle of deep listening, fostering harmonious relationships with each other, the land, the sea, and all creatures, ensuring mutual respect and understanding.
elements.label: Relationships of deep listening to each other, the land, the sea and all the creatures

elements.summary: Embrace a circular approach over a linear one to promote sustainability by prioritizing resource regeneration, waste reduction, and continuous reuse.
elements.label: SHIFT Approach FROM Linear only TO circular most of the time

elements.summary: Embrace the principle of transforming risk by moving from avoiding discomfort to actively engaging in building a shared, sustainable future.
elements.label: SHIFT Risk FROM running away from pain TO stepping towards our collective future

elements.summary: Transform environments from toxic crises to mutually supportive by fostering collaboration, empathy, and sustainable practices for a harmonious future.
elements.label: SHIFT Environment FROM Toxic Crises TO mutually supportive

elements.summary: Focus on measuring success by the quality and impact of contributions rather than the sheer scale or speed of growth to foster a more sustainable and equitable future.
elements.label: SHIFT Metrics FROM Growth TO Volume

elements.summary: "SHIFT Motivation FROM Me TO We" emphasizes the importance of prioritizing collective well-being and collaboration over individual gain to create a more harmonious and sustainable future.
elements.label: SHIFT Motivation FROM Me TO We

elements.summary: "SHIFT Learning FROM Directed TO Resonance" emphasizes moving from a structured, teacher-led approach to a more dynamic, student-centered learning experience that fosters engagement and personal connection with the material.
elements.label: SHIFT Learning FROM Directed TO Resonance
Food portions must be smaller to reduce helath problems and left overs leading to waste.

elements.label: Topic Clusters Graph

elements.summary: The miro board from 3.17 with the individual and synthesized thoughts that came out of people envisioning their ideal futures
elements.label: Metafuture Miro Board

elements.summary: Urban and climate innovation champion working in energy, climate tech, and climate finance
elements.label: Chante Harris

elements.summary: Working towards safeguarding democracy in the digital age, combating polarization, anti-democratic practices, and extremism.
elements.label: Yael Eisenstadt

elements.summary: Impact investor and current co-lead of the Catalytic Impact Investing program "which seeks to deploy patient, flexible and creative capital into alternative investment and business models that demonstrate a new economic system based on solidarity and sustainability"
elements.description:
From [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sydney-bolger/):

> I work with people and projects to shift consciousness and capital toward a more beautiful and just world. I've begun identifying as part of a network of âinterstitionariesââas coined in Jennifer Brandelâs, âInvisible Landscapesââwho work across disciplines and sectors to facilitate collaboration, surface insights, and drive systemic change. I do this through my work with The ImPact, a network of families committed to creating a positive impact with their wealth, and a Steward of Linestone, a network of leaders across disciplines, cultivating the conditions for radical collaboration towards a more more wise, peaceful, humane, and convivial world. 
> 
> The Global Financial Crisis and ensuing Occupy Movement were hallmarks of my undergraduate experience, catalyzing inquiry into the fragility of our financial and economic systems. The more I dug, the clearer it became that these systems were not designed in service of life. I soon discovered the impact investing movement, which sought to transform our financial systems to mitigate harm and create positive outcomes. I began my career in impact investing working with families and foundations to create 100% values-aligned portfolios and co-created a Catalytic Impact Investing Program, working with funders and investors on the leading edge of systems change to invest $100M+ of patient, flexible, and creative capital that prioritized impact over financial return through innovative investment and business models. 
> 
> Recognizing the limits of working within the financial system to create economic systems change, I took a year to study at Schumacher College, exploring how we arrived at our current economic system and how we might create the conditions for regenerative economic systems to emerge. This was a profound experience deep diving into holistic science, complexity theory, systems thinking, deep ecology, while inhabiting a living laboratory of experiments in regenerative economies. Inspired by Donella Meadows, âPlaces to Intervene in a System,â I became curious about how to shift consciousness and culture from which systems emerge. Stewarding Linestone with an exceptional group of creative collaborators, I honed the craft of designing experiences that expand our sense of what is possible, create deep relationships of trust, and build our capacity to co-create the emergent future. 
> 
> I delight in working with creative collaborators at different altitudes from my neighborhood in Brooklyn, NY to global networks and systems.
elements.label: Sydney Bolger

elements.summary: Pioneer of the adaptive leadership methodology - an advisor, leadership strategist, and consultant
elements.label: Zander Grashow

elements.summary: Leader of the Democracy Innovation Hub who talks about deliberative democracy, citizens assemblies, and community-building.
elements.label: Phil Lindsay

elements.summary: Agricultural scientist and the Founder of a non-profit venture, CowBell Labs, which develops measurement technology and standards for agriculture methane.
elements.label: Doc Brown

elements.summary: American media theorist, writer, columnist, lecturer, graphic novelist, and documentarian.
elements.label: Douglas Rushkoff
The Three Horizons of innovation and culture change

elements.summary: Vincent is the founder of Catalist

elements.summary: A list of metacrisis-related books curated by Benjamin Von Wong
elements.label: Metacrisis Reading List

elements.summary: Explores how societies rebuild after collapseâfoundation for designing post-collapse institutions. Cross-cultural studies of how complex societies have reappeared after periods of decentralization.
elements.label: After Collapse: The Regeneration of Complex Societies

elements.summary: A portrait of traditional Ladakhi culture before Western development, contrasting it with the changes that occurred after 1975. Offers crucial lessons in sustainable development by examining how relentless economic growth and modernization impact ancient cultures and their relationship with the environment.
elements.label: Ancient Futures

elements.summary: From the bestselling author of The Black Swan and one of the foremost philosophers of our time, Nassim Nicholas Taleb, a book on how some systems actually benefit from disorder. In The Black Swan Taleb outlined a problem; in Antifragile he offers a definitive solution: how to gain from disorder and chaos while being protected from fragilities and adverse events. For what he calls the 'antifragile' is one step beyond robust, as it benefits from adversity, uncertainty and stressors, just as human bones get stronger when subjected to stress and tension.
elements.label: Antifragile

elements.summary: Psychospiritual resilience practices for living in ongoing crisis. Offers interspiritual wisdom and contemplative practices for maintaining sanity and compassion in collapse.
elements.label: Apocalypse Anytime: An Interspiritual Devotional for a World on Fire

elements.summary: Explains energy/resource decline dynamics and proposes pathways to manage contraction. Shows how collapse is a feature of complex systems and offers guidance for navigating decline.
elements.label: Before the Collapse: A Guide to the Other Side of Growth

elements.summary: Details how science is studying nature's best ideas to solve our toughest 21st-century problems. The practice of biomimicry allows us to study nature's geniusâphotosynthesis, brain power, and shellsâand adapt them for human use, taking advantage of 3.8 billion years of evolutionary R&D.
elements.label: Biomimicry: Innovation Inspired by Nature

elements.summary: Exposes the latest frontier of the North's ongoing assault against the South's biological and other resources. Since land, forests, oceans, and atmosphere have been colonized and polluted, Northern capital is now carving out new colonies to exploit: the interior spaces of bodies of women, plants and animals.
elements.label: Biopiracy

elements.summary: How do we learn from and integrate the wisdom of indigenous cultures into our attempts to transform our industrialized societies? With love, respect, care and the ten precepts of the "noble harvest," Kimmerer reorients us towards awe, gratitude and the possibilities for equipoise and symbiosis with our more than human kin.
elements.label: Braiding Sweetgrass

elements.summary: Summarized simply in the most well-researched way. Capital beats labor. Everywhere, but only according to our current rule sets.
elements.label: Capital in the 21st Century

elements.summary: A collection of essays, reflections, poems, and artwork by Nora Bateson exploring complexity, systems thinking, and the patterns in ecology of living systems. Her work brings together biology, cognition, art, anthropology, and psychology to examine how we might improve our perception of complexity.
elements.label: Combining

elements.summary: Recontextualizes human agency, praise, blame and the ways in which we might imagine John Rawl's "just society." What do we owe to those born into less privileged spots in the birth lottery? How do we design so that nobody is ground down or left behind? What does it mean to maximize for the manifestation of human fulfillment, imagination and talents?
elements.label: Creating Freedom

elements.summary: On how money and ledgers shape our every experience and how market systems might be reconstituted based on different principles.
elements.label: Debt: The First 5,000 Years

elements.summary: Essays outlining the Deep Adaptation framework (resilience, relinquishment, restoration) to face climate chaos. Shows how professionals are incorporating acceptance of societal breakdown into their work.
elements.label: Deep Adaptation: Navigating the Realities of Climate Chaos

elements.summary: A comprehensive analysis examining what's wrong with our societies, organizations, and ecosystems. Offers a framework for the transition to regenerative cultures that work with rather than against natural systems, emphasizing the restoration and enhancement of ecosystem health.
elements.label: Designing Regenerative Cultures

elements.summary: The just, distributive and regenerative space within which human industry and civilization must learn to operate. Breaks the spell of the groupthink of neoclassical economics.
elements.label: Doughnut Economics: Seven Ways to Think Like a 21st Century Economist

elements.summary: Inspired by Octavia Butler's explorations of our human relationship to change, Emergent Strategy is radical self-help, society-help, and planet-help designed to shape the futures we want to live. Change is constant. The world is in a continual state of flux. It is a stream of ever-mutating, emergent patterns. Rather than steel ourselves against such change, this book invites us to feel, map, assess, and learn from the swirling patterns around us in order to better shape them and better shape the future.
elements.label: Emergent Strategy

elements.summary: Uses historical data modeling to explain elite competition, inequality and political instability as collapse drivers. Applies cliodynamics to understand America's civil strife and possible outcomes.
elements.label: End Times: Elites, Counter-Elites, and the Path of Political Disintegration

elements.summary: Explores the spectacular world of fungi and their role in sustaining nearly all living systems. Fungi can solve problems without a brain, manipulate animal behavior, and have shaped human history through bread, alcohol, and medicine. Their psychedelic properties have recently been shown to alleviate depression and anxiety.
elements.label: Entangled Life

elements.summary: Argues that large hierarchical Goliath societies are inherently fragileâthrough historical comparison of hundreds of collapses identifies patterns (elite capture, inequality, extractive institutions) and offers a diagnosis of current global civilization plus suggestions for building more just, resilient systems.
elements.label: Goliath"s Curse: The History and Future of Societal Collapse

elements.summary: A Green Swan is a profound market shift that delivers exponential progress in economic, social and environmental wealth creation. Elkington examines how breakthrough solutions through regenerative capitalism can take us beyond black swan crises toward positive transformation of business and society.
elements.label: Green Swans: The Coming Boom In Regenerative Capitalism

elements.summary: Synthetic review of interacting collapse drivers; argues for resilience, mutual aid and localization. Confronts the possibility of civilizational collapse and connects scientific findings to everyday experience.
elements.label: How Everything Can Collapse: A Manual for Our Times

elements.summary: Through a blend of compelling exercises, illustrations, and stories, the bestselling author of Thinking in Bets will train you to combat your own biases, address your weaknesses, and help you become a better and more confident decision-maker. What do you do when you're faced with a big decision? If you're like most people, you probably make gut calls more often than you'd like to admit.
elements.label: How to Decide

elements.summary: Multidisciplinary case studies teaching how systemic fragility emerges and how societies can learn from the past. Uses history, systems thinking, and complexity science to understand collapse.
elements.label: How Worlds Collapse: What History, Systems, and Complexity Can Teach Us About Our Modern World and Fragile Future

elements.summary: Blends grief, activism and humor as tools for cultural and emotional resilience. An existential manual for living with climate doom that searches out leading climate thinkers for guidance.
elements.label: I Want a Better Catastrophe: Navigating the Climate Crisis with Grief, Hope and Gallows Humor

elements.summary: An exploration of technology's failure and the survival of indigenous nations. Examines how modern industrial societies have lost connection to the sacred and what we can learn from indigenous wisdom about living in balance with nature and community.
elements.label: In The Absence of The Sacred

elements.summary: Economist's catalog of interconnected global macro-threats with stabilization policy guidance. Explores debt, AI, deglobalization, geopolitical conflict, climate change, and other overlapping dangers.
elements.label: MegaThreats: Ten Dangerous Trends That Imperil Our Future, and How to Survive Them

elements.summary: Describes a new type of industrialism that is more efficient and profitable while saving the environment and creating jobs. Shows how leading-edge companies practice natural capitalism by radically increasing resource productivity, eliminating waste, and restoring natural capital.
elements.label: Natural Capitalism

elements.summary: Exposes the unaccountable actions of the ultra-rich and their model of philanthrocapitalism, which deploys unaccountable money to bypass democratic structures, derail diversity, and impose totalitarian ideas. Argues for a shift from concentrated wealth and power to ecological and social regeneration.
elements.label: Oneness vs The 1%

elements.summary: One of Fuller's most popular works offering a brilliant synthesis of his world view. Investigates the great challenges facing humanity on Spaceship Earth, including how humanity will survive, how automation influences individualization, and how we can utilize our resources most effectively.
elements.label: Operating Manual for Spaceship Earth

elements.summary: An invaluable guide to understanding how social media has triggered an urgent society-wide crisis of trust. Drawing from deep historical context and cutting-edge research, this book explores how tech amplifies discontent, disrupts democracy, and what we can do about it. Foreword by Jonathan Haidt.
elements.label: Outrage Machine

elements.summary: From the bestselling author of Thinking in Bets comes a toolkit for mastering the skill of quitting to achieve greater success. Business leaders, with millions of dollars down the drain, struggle to abandon a new app or product that just isn't working. Governments, caught in a hopeless conflict, believe that the next tactic will finally be the one that works. While grit can get you to stick to hard things that are worthwhile, it can also mean staying with something when it's time to stop.
elements.label: Quit: The power of knowing when to walk away

elements.summary: A radically new understanding of and practical approach to climate change. Addresses issues by weaving equity, justice, climate, and biodiversity together, emphasizing that regeneration of land, water, forests, and biodiversity can reverse the causes of climate change and poverty.
elements.label: Regeneration

elements.summary: Few thinkers have done more to spread the ideas of a regenerative economy than John. Here our challenges, opportunities and terrain are mapped out. An important read to frame our time together.
elements.label: Regenerative Economics: Revolutionary Thinking for a World in Crisis

elements.summary: Building on Gregory Bateson's work, Nora Bateson updates thinking on systems and ecosystems, applying insights to education, organizations, complexity, and how society organizes itself. A revolutionary personal approach to the study of systems and their interdependencies.
elements.label: Small Arcs of Larger Circles

elements.summary: Our ability to pay attention is collapsing. College students now focus on one task for only 65 seconds, and office workers manage only three minutes. Johann Hari went on an epic journey across the world to interview leading scientists about what has happened to our attention, and how to get it back.
elements.label: Stolen Focus

elements.summary: Describes how industrial agriculture steals food from nature and poor people. Chronicles the hijacking of the global food supply by corporate interests and makes the case for food democracy as the new agenda for ecological sustainability and social justice.
elements.label: Stolen Harvest

elements.summary: Examines transitions from industrial to sustainable socio-economic systems and argues for just, multisectoral pathways. Explores how to understand the dynamics of transitions toward sustainability.
elements.label: The Age of Sustainability: Just Transitions in a Complex World

elements.summary: After more than a decade of stability, the mental health of adolescents plunged in the early 2010s. Rates of depression, anxiety, self-harm, and suicide rose sharply. Social psychologist Jonathan Haidt investigates the epidemic of teen mental illness and explores how the great rewiring of childhood through smartphones and social media is causing widespread harm.
elements.label: The Anxious Generation

elements.summary: Foundational work showing collapse often results from diminishing returns on social complexity. Societies solve problems by increasing complexity until marginal returns decline and collapse becomes inevitable.
elements.label: The Collapse of Complex Societies

elements.summary: Explores how information is more fundamental than energy, matter, space, or time. Examines research across many fields showing our Universe is in-formed and holographically manifested, with fractal informational patterns guiding behavior from atomic to galactic scales.
elements.label: The Cosmic Hologram

elements.summary: An exploration of the vast diversity of economics, social contracts and cultures that have run just fine on all sorts of agreements. Inspiration from the past to rediversify our futures.
elements.label: The Dawn of Everything

elements.summary: A visionary program for businesses to help restore the planet. Examines the relationship between business and the environment, offering a declaration of sustainability that bridges the gap between commerce and ecology through practical, implementable strategies.
elements.label: The Ecology of Commerce

elements.summary: Framework mapping collapse from financial through cultural stages with survival strategies. Provides taxonomy of collapse stages and suggests how to prepare for and navigate each phase.
elements.label: The Five Stages of Collapse: Survivors" Toolkit

elements.summary: Argues that corporate consolidation is a manifestation of Empire: the organization of society through hierarchies of domination. For 5,000 years this has meant fortune for the few and misery for the many. Offers a vision of Earth Community as an alternative to imperial rule.
elements.label: The Great Turning

elements.summary: Our starting point. The case that economic growth cannot be dematerialized, that infinite growth on a finite planet is a self-terminating algorithm.
elements.label: The Limits to Growth

elements.summary: Robinson is known as a science fiction writer but is in fact using near future scenarios to play out ideas as a political and economic theoretician. The Mars Trilogy is the birth of an ecological society where the primacy of biodiversity undergirds all aspects of a new society. In short this is a narrative in service to our own reinvention here on earth today.
elements.label: The Mars Trilogy

elements.summary: Robinson has done his research and points out the shoots of the Third Horizon already here in this work of near future fiction. It's a hopeful and rapid transformation of all humanity into an ecological culture, following on a climate change tragedy.
elements.label: The Ministry for the Future

elements.summary: Why are we obsessed with the things we want and bored when we get them? This book explores how a single chemical in your brainâdopamineâdrives love, sex, and creativity, and will determine the fate of the human race. A fascinating look at the neuroscience behind desire and satisfaction.
elements.label: The Molecule of More

elements.summary: The next crisis might be here now, or it might be around the corner. Two history-making experts in crisis leadershipâWharton Dean Erika H. James and Lynn Perry Wooten, president of Simmons Universityâargue that the time to prepare is always. They urge leaders to break the cycle of panic and neglect and develop prepared leadership as a core competency to emerge from any crisis more resilient than before.
elements.label: The Prepared Leader

elements.summary: Shows leaders why today's business best practices undermine success and provides a proven path to redesign work, cultivate human potential, and achieve extraordinary outcomes. Offers a regenerative approach that unlocks innovation, financial results, and customer loyalty while building human capacity.
elements.label: The Regenerative Business

elements.summary: Comprehensive handbook for practitioners covering polycrisis, public administration, policy, and governance. Addresses crisis management in an era of interconnected global challenges.
elements.label: The Routledge Handbook on Crisis, Polycrisis, and Public Administration

elements.summary: Explores how the Universe, our planet, ourselves, and everything in existence has inherent meaning and evolutionary purpose. Examines our emergence as self-aware members of a Universe that is itself a unified and innately sentient entity that exists to evolve.
elements.label: The Story of Gaia

elements.summary: A compelling vision of a new reality and reconciliation of science and the human spirit. Argues we've reached a turning point requiring a new holistic paradigm that allows the forces transforming our world to flow together as positive social change, moving beyond mechanistic thinking.
elements.label: The Turning Point

elements.summary: A brilliant synthesis of scientific breakthroughs including complexity theory, Gaia theory, and chaos theory. Explores how information underpins physical reality and examines the properties of organisms, social systems, and ecosystems through the lens of interconnection and interdependence.
elements.label: The Web of Life

elements.summary: A complete recontextualization of the human predicament and approaching the universe as one vastly interdependent web, where "negentropy" is our clarion call and "Wendigo Inc." the wrong turn we can choose to abandon.
elements.label: The Web of Meaning: Integrating Science and Traditional Wisdom to Find Our Place in the Universe

elements.summary: A Nobel winning meditation in behavioral economics and human decision making. The fallacy of homo-economicus exploded. The promise of applied behavioral science revealed.
elements.label: Thinking Fast and Slow

elements.summary: A way to shape our designing of new economic systems and how we might gently foster a truly regenerative society.
elements.label: Thinking in Systems: A Primer

elements.summary: Academic overview critiquing oversimplified collapse narratives and offering nuance. Examines collapse of ancient civilizations and critically evaluates how we construct myths around collapse.
elements.label: Understanding Collapse: Ancient History and Modern Myths

elements.summary: Examines the water wars of the twenty-first century and the aggressive privatization by multinationals of communal water rights. While drought and desertification intensify, corporations convert free-flowing water into bottled profits, threatening democratic access to this essential resource.
elements.label: Water Wars

elements.summary: A brilliant exploration of different kinds of intelligenceâplant, animal, human, artificialâand how they transform our understanding of humans' place in the cosmos. Examines what it means to be intelligent and how recognizing non-human intelligence can reshape our world.
elements.label: Ways of Being

elements.summary: Examines the global spread of corporate power as a malignant cancer exercising market tyranny that destroys lives, democratic institutions, and ecosystems for the benefit of corporations and investors. A classic on the destructive nature of the global corporate economy.
elements.label: When Corporations Rule the World

elements.summary: Leadership and community-based strategies for navigating systems-level turbulence. A call to reclaim leadership as noble profession creating possibility and humaneness amid fear and chaos.
elements.label: Who Do We Choose to Be?: Facing Reality, Claiming Leadership, Restoring Sanity

elements.summary: How to empty our cups of our expertise and expertise in preparation for co-imagining and co-implementing.
elements.label: Zen Mind, Beginner"s Mind

connections.label: is in moral alignment with
connections.description: The synergy between "Faith must be strong" and "Compassion with Truth" lies in the balance of unwavering belief and empathetic honesty, fostering a foundation where conviction is guided by understanding and sincerity. This harmony ensures that faith is not blind but informed by genuine care and truthfulness.
connections.title: Faith must be strong is in moral alignment with Compassion with Truth

connections.label: is in ethical harmony with
connections.description: Compassion with Truth fosters understanding and empathy, allowing for honest communication that respects and acknowledges others' feelings. Truth and Love work together to create a foundation of trust and authenticity, nurturing relationships through genuine care and openness.
connections.title: Compassion with Truth is in ethical harmony with Truth and Love

connections.label: is in cultural unity with
connections.description: Truth, Love, and Beauty are interconnected, with Truth providing a foundation for genuine Love, which in turn enhances the perception of Beauty, creating a harmonious balance that should be cherished.
connections.title: Compassion with Truth is in cultural unity with Beauty must be cherished

connections.label: cost pressures impact
connections.description: The tension arises from the need to align incentives with the goal of promoting healthier, more affordable, and efficient food choices, as current incentives may not adequately support or prioritize these outcomes. Balancing economic and health objectives requires rethinking and restructuring incentives to encourage sustainable and beneficial food practices.
connections.title: A better world requires better incentives. cost pressures impact we must eat healthier, cheaper, more efficient food

connections.label: nutritional alignment
connections.description: The synergy between "we must eat healthier, cheaper, more efficient food" and "food must be medicine" lies in the pursuit of accessible, nutrient-rich diets that promote well-being and prevent disease, while being cost-effective and sustainable. This approach emphasizes the role of food in maintaining health and reducing healthcare costs.
connections.title: we must eat healthier, cheaper, more efficient food nutritional alignment Food must be medicine and accessible

connections.label: ecosystem health
connections.description: The synergy between fertile soil and clear water lies in their combined ability to support robust plant growth, as nutrient-rich soil provides essential minerals while clear water ensures efficient nutrient absorption and healthy root development. Together, they create an optimal environment for thriving ecosystems.
connections.title: Soil must be fertile ecosystem health Water must be clear

connections.label: environmental unity
connections.description: The synergy between "Air must be fresh" and "Existence must be regenerative" lies in their shared commitment to sustainability, where maintaining clean air supports the regenerative processes essential for a thriving ecosystem. Together, they emphasize the importance of preserving natural resources to ensure a healthy and sustainable future.
connections.title: Air must be fresh environmental unity Existence must be regenerative

connections.label: sustainable energy
connections.description: Phasing out fossil fuels aligns with the principle of sustainability, ensuring that our actions today do not compromise the ability of future generations to meet their needs, thereby allowing everything we do to be done indefinitely.
connections.title: we must phase out fossil fuels sustainable energy everything we do we can do forever.

connections.label: empowered decision
connections.description: Decentralizing power empowers individuals and fosters innovation, while coordinated efforts ensure alignment towards common goals. By establishing better incentives, we can motivate collective action and drive progress towards a more equitable and efficient world.
connections.title: power must be decentralized but people must be coordinated empowered decision A better world requires better incentives.

connections.label: coordination challenge
connections.description: The tension lies in balancing sustainable practices with the need for decentralized power structures, while ensuring effective coordination among individuals to achieve collective goals. This requires innovative approaches to governance and collaboration that respect autonomy yet foster unity.
connections.title: everything we do we can do forever. coordination challenge power must be decentralized but people must be coordinated

connections.label: tradition clash
connections.description: The tension between the belief that faith must be strong and the necessity to phase out fossil fuels lies in balancing spiritual convictions with the urgent need for environmental action, as some may see reliance on fossil fuels as conflicting with stewardship of the Earth. This dichotomy challenges communities to reconcile their faith-based values with sustainable practices for the planet's future.
connections.title: Faith must be strong tradition clash we must phase out fossil fuels

connections.label: is in alignment with
connections.description: The synergy between eating healthier, cheaper, and more efficient food and the concept of food as medicine and accessible lies in promoting dietary choices that are both affordable and beneficial to health, ensuring that nutritious options are available to all, thereby preventing disease and enhancing well-being.
connections.title: we must eat healthier, cheaper, more efficient food is in alignment with Food must be medicine and accessible

connections.label: supports sustainable longevity
connections.description: The synergy between "everything we do we can do forever" and "existence must be regenerative" emphasizes a sustainable approach where actions are designed to be perpetually viable, ensuring that our existence continuously renews and supports the environment and society.
connections.title: everything we do we can do forever. supports sustainable longevity Existence must be regenerative

connections.label: drives clean energy transition
connections.description: Phasing out fossil fuels aligns with the transition to clean and abundant energy sources, reducing environmental impact while ensuring sustainable and reliable energy for the future. This synergy supports global efforts to combat climate change and promote energy security.
connections.title: we must phase out fossil fuels drives clean energy transition Clean and abundant source of energy

connections.label: enables coordinated power reimagination
connections.description: The synergy between decentralizing power and coordinating people lies in reimagining power structures to balance individual autonomy with collective action, ensuring that both personal and communal needs are met effectively. This approach fosters a critical and cohesive framework where power is distributed equitably, yet aligned towards common goals.
connections.title: power must be decentralized but people must be coordinated enables coordinated power reimagination Critical and cohesive re-imagining of Power based on both individual and collective needs

connections.label: nourishes spiritual purpose
connections.description: The synergy between "Faith must be strong" and "We must return to love" emphasizes that a steadfast belief system and a commitment to love are essential for fulfilling our purpose in life, guiding us towards a harmonious and meaningful existence.
connections.title: Faith must be strong nourishes spiritual purpose We must return to love as the purpose of our existence

connections.label: cultivates empathetic openness
connections.description: The synergy between compassion and truth, combined with open hearts and minds, fosters an environment where understanding and empathy thrive, allowing for genuine connections and meaningful dialogue. This harmonious blend encourages growth, acceptance, and the pursuit of shared goals.
connections.title: Compassion with Truth cultivates empathetic openness Open hearts and minds

connections.label: ensures water clarity
connections.description: The synergy between "Water must be clear" and "Clean water" emphasizes the importance of maintaining water quality that is both visually transparent and free from contaminants, ensuring it is safe and healthy for consumption and the environment.
connections.title: Water must be clear ensures water clarity clean water

connections.label: reinforces soil vitality
connections.description: The synergy between fertile soil and clean water is essential for sustainable agriculture, as fertile soil provides the necessary nutrients for plant growth, while clean water ensures that these nutrients are effectively absorbed and utilized by plants. Together, they create an optimal environment for healthy crop production and ecosystem balance.
connections.title: Soil must be fertile reinforces soil vitality Water must be clean. Soil must be fertile.

connections.label: ensures breathable air
connections.description: The synergy between "Air must be fresh" and "healthy water, food, air; shelter & safety" emphasizes the interconnectedness of essential elements for well-being, highlighting the importance of clean air as a fundamental component of a healthy and secure living environment.
connections.title: Air must be fresh ensures breathable air healthy water, food, air; shelter & safety

connections.label: promotes natural autonomy
connections.description: The synergy between autonomous natural systems and the integration with nature emphasizes the importance of self-regulating ecosystems working in harmony with human efforts to act as stewards of the Earth, fostering a sustainable and interconnected relationship with the planet.
connections.title: Natural systems must be autonomous promotes natural autonomy integration and connectedness with nature and the planet stewards of mother earth

connections.label: fosters localized resilience
connections.description: The synergy between localized life support systems and the essentials of healthy water, food, air, shelter, and safety lies in their integrated approach to sustaining human well-being by ensuring that these critical resources are readily available and managed efficiently within a community. This interconnectedness enhances resilience and self-sufficiency, promoting a sustainable living environment.
connections.title: Life support systems must be localized fosters localized resilience healthy water, food, air; shelter & safety

connections.label: enables effective self-regulation
connections.description: The synergy between tight feedback loops and self-regulating systems lies in their ability to quickly adapt and correct course, ensuring stability and efficiency by continuously monitoring and adjusting to changes in the environment. This dynamic interaction enhances system resilience and performance.
connections.title: Feedback loops must be tight enables effective self-regulation we must design systems that are self-regulating

connections.label: integrates accessible education
connections.description: Education must be embedded in the environment to ensure that learning is relevant and contextually meaningful, while accessibility ensures that all individuals, regardless of their circumstances, can benefit from these educational opportunities. Together, they create a holistic approach that fosters inclusive and practical learning experiences.
connections.title: Education must be embedded in the environment integrates accessible education Education must be accessible.

connections.label: stimulates critical inquiry
connections.description: The synergy between frequently discussing philosophy and learning not to believe everything we think lies in fostering critical thinking and self-awareness, encouraging individuals to question assumptions and explore diverse perspectives. This combination promotes intellectual humility and a deeper understanding of complex ideas.
connections.title: Philosophy must be discussed often stimulates critical inquiry we must learn how to not believe everything we think

connections.label: strengthens generational unity
connections.description: The synergy between different generations fosters a collaborative environment where diverse perspectives and experiences are valued, leading to innovative solutions and strengthened community bonds. By working towards unity, these generations can bridge gaps, promote mutual understanding, and create a more cohesive society.
connections.title: Different generations must be connected strengthens generational unity Work towards unity

connections.label: aligns collective vision
connections.description: The synergy between having a vision that is articulated, socially shared, and formulated, and community engagement lies in transforming individual aspirations into collective action, fostering a sense of ownership and collaboration that shifts the focus from "me" to "we." This alignment encourages inclusive participation and empowers communities to work together towards common goals.
connections.title: we must have a vision that is articulated, socially shared & formulated aligns collective vision community engagement- from ME to WE

connections.label: challenges equitable distribution
connections.description: The tension lies in balancing the need for vigilance in protecting shared resources from exploitation with ensuring that the advantages of automation and technology are equitably shared, preventing further inequality and ensuring collective benefit.
connections.title: we must always be prepared and ready to defend the commons against those who want to exploit it challenges equitable distribution the benefits of automation and technology must be distributed

connections.label: limits profit-driven growth
connections.description: The tension arises from the need to balance economic growth with sustainability, ensuring that profit-driven motives do not compromise essential life support systems. This requires implementing growth strategies that respect environmental and social boundaries to maintain long-term viability.
connections.title: The economics needs to support growth, but within limits. limits profit-driven growth money/profit incentives must end within any life support system

connections.label: undermines incentive alignment
connections.description: The tension arises from the conflict between prioritizing profit incentives, which can undermine the integrity of life support systems, and designing incentive-based systems that align with and promote collective well-being, ensuring sustainability and ethical responsibility.
connections.title: money/profit incentives must end within any life support system undermines incentive alignment incentive based systems align with collective well-being

connections.label: integrates holistic education
connections.description: Education should integrate mental, spiritual, physical, and financial health to foster holistic development, ensuring that such comprehensive learning is accessible to all.
connections.title: Mental, spiritual, physical and financial health, but be embedded in education. integrates holistic education Education must be accessible.

connections.label: challenges spiritual certainty
connections.description: The tension lies in balancing skepticism of our thoughts with the need for a spiritual connection to transcend fear, suggesting that discernment and faith must coexist to achieve inner peace.
connections.title: we must learn how to not believe everything we think challenges spiritual certainty There must be a connection to the Divine or Higher Self to overcome fear.

connections.label: balances systemic regulation
connections.description: The synergy between nervous system regulation across populations and holistic healthâmental, spiritual, physical, and financialâcan be embedded in education by integrating practices that promote balance and resilience, fostering a comprehensive understanding of well-being that prepares individuals for life's challenges.
connections.title: nervous system regulation across pupulations balances systemic regulation Mental, spiritual, physical and financial health, but be embedded in education.

connections.label: enhances universal safety
connections.description: The synergy between ensuring safety for all and implementing safety nets lies in creating a secure environment where individuals are protected from harm while also having support systems that reduce the necessity for mere survival, fostering a more resilient and equitable society.
connections.title: safety for all enhances universal safety Safety nets need to be put in place to lessen the need for survival.

connections.label: promotes ethical collaboration
connections.description: The synergy between ethical platforms and consistent sharing of ideas, visions, knowledge, and resources fosters a shift from individualistic "ME" perspectives to a collective "WE" mindset, enhancing community engagement by building trust, collaboration, and mutual support.
connections.title: Ethical platforms and consistent sharing of ideas, visions, knowledge and resources promotes ethical collaboration community engagement- from ME to WE

connections.label: bolsters agricultural health
connections.description: Healthy soil is the foundation of sustainable agriculture, providing essential nutrients for seeds to grow into robust crops, which in turn support resilient food systems. Fertile soil enhances this synergy by ensuring optimal plant growth, leading to increased agricultural productivity and food security.
connections.title: healthy soil, seeds, agriculture and food systems bolsters agricultural health Soil must be fertile

connections.label: deepens environmental integration
connections.description: The synergy between integration and connectedness with nature emphasizes the role of planetary stewards in ensuring clean water and fertile soil, fostering a harmonious relationship with Mother Earth.
connections.title: integration and connectedness with nature and the planet stewards of mother earth deepens environmental integration Water must be clean. Soil must be fertile.

connections.label: embodies earth connection
connections.description: "HOME, an acronym for Heaven On Mother Earth, embodies the synergy of integration and connectedness with nature, emphasizing our role as stewards of the planet to nurture and protect the environment."
connections.title: HOMEHeavenOnMotherEarth embodies earth connection integration and connectedness with nature and the planet stewards of mother earth

connections.label: fosters collective wisdom
connections.description: The synergy between collective intelligence and community engagement transforms individual efforts into a unified force, fostering collaboration and shared goals that shift the focus from "me" to "we." This approach harnesses diverse perspectives and strengths, enhancing problem-solving and innovation within communities.
connections.title: Collective rather than individual intelligence. fosters collective wisdom community engagement- from ME to WE

connections.label: inspires spiritual awakening
connections.description: Awakened states of being foster a deep connection to the Divine or Higher Self, enabling individuals to transcend fear by accessing inner wisdom and strength. This synergy empowers personal growth and spiritual enlightenment, facilitating a fearless approach to life's challenges.
connections.title: Awakened states of being inspires spiritual awakening There must be a connection to the Divine or Higher Self to overcome fear.

connections.label: fosters regenerative zero waste
connections.description: The synergy between a zero waste society and the principle that existence must be regenerative lies in their shared goal of minimizing environmental impact by promoting sustainable practices that restore and replenish natural resources. Together, they advocate for a circular economy where waste is eliminated, and ecosystems are revitalized, ensuring a balanced and thriving planet.
connections.title: Zero waste society fosters regenerative zero waste Existence must be regenerative

connections.label: empowers self-realization
connections.description: The synergy between remembering who we truly are and what we are capable of, and having open hearts and minds, lies in the empowerment and growth that comes from self-awareness and receptivity to new ideas and perspectives. This combination fosters personal and collective transformation, enabling individuals to reach their full potential while embracing diversity and innovation.
connections.title: We must remember who we truly are and what we are capable of. empowers self-realization Open hearts and minds

connections.label: strengthens interconnected communities
connections.description: The synergy between high quality and quantity of interconnection and community engagement transforms individual efforts ("ME") into collective impact ("WE"), fostering a collaborative environment where shared goals and mutual support drive community growth and resilience.
connections.title: high quality and quantity of interconnection strengthens interconnected communities community engagement- from ME to WE

connections.label: ensures secure living
connections.description: The synergy between healthy water, food, air, shelter, and safety with housing needs emphasizes the importance of ensuring that housing is not only available and affordable but also spacious enough to accommodate more people, thereby promoting overall well-being and sustainability.
connections.title: healthy water, food, air; shelter & safety ensures secure living Housing needs to be available and affordable. Housing needs to be bigger to house more people.

connections.label: boosts incentive abundance
connections.description: Synergy between systems that incentivize abundance and those aligned with collective well-being fosters a harmonious environment where resources are optimized for both individual prosperity and communal health, ensuring sustainable growth and shared benefits. This alignment encourages innovation and cooperation, driving progress that benefits all stakeholders.
connections.title: systems that incentivize abundance & what"s right boosts incentive abundance incentive based systems align with collective well-being

connections.label: enhances relational connectivity
connections.description: The synergy between deep listening to each other, the land, the sea, and all creatures fosters a profound integration and connectedness with nature, empowering us to become responsible stewards of Mother Earth. This harmonious relationship nurtures mutual respect and understanding, essential for the sustainable care of our planet.
connections.title: Relationships of deep listening to each other, the land, the sea and all the creatures enhances relational connectivity integration and connectedness with nature and the planet stewards of mother earth

connections.label: drives circular learning
connections.description: The synergy between shifting from a linear to a predominantly circular approach and transitioning from directed to resonance learning lies in fostering adaptability and interconnectedness, encouraging continuous feedback and collaboration for more holistic and sustainable outcomes.
connections.title: SHIFT Approach FROM Linear only TO circular most of the time drives circular learning SHIFT Learning FROM Directed TO Resonance

connections.label: encourages collective courage
connections.description: The synergy between shifting risk from avoiding pain to embracing our collective future and shifting motivation from individual to collective focuses on fostering a collaborative mindset that prioritizes shared goals and resilience, driving progress and innovation through unity and mutual support.
connections.title: SHIFT Risk FROM running away from pain TO stepping towards our collective future encourages collective courage SHIFT Motivation FROM Me TO We

connections.label: redefines supportive metrics
connections.description: The synergy between shifting the environment from toxic crises to mutually supportive and shifting metrics from growth to volume lies in fostering a collaborative atmosphere that prioritizes sustainable practices and collective well-being, while focusing on meaningful engagement and impact rather than mere expansion.
connections.title: SHIFT Environment FROM Toxic Crises TO mutually supportive redefines supportive metrics SHIFT Metrics FROM Growth TO Volume

connections.label: aligns motivational learning
connections.description: The synergy between shifting motivation from "me" to "we" and learning from "directed" to "resonance" lies in fostering a collaborative environment where collective goals drive personal growth, and learning becomes a shared, engaging experience that resonates with all participants. This approach encourages individuals to align personal aspirations with group objectives, enhancing both motivation and learning outcomes.
connections.title: SHIFT Motivation FROM Me TO We aligns motivational learning SHIFT Learning FROM Directed TO Resonance

connections.label: optimizes food consumption
connections.description: Balancing smaller food portions to reduce health issues with minimizing leftovers can lead to healthier, more cost-effective eating habits, reducing waste and promoting efficiency. This synergy encourages mindful consumption, aligning with the goal of eating healthier and more economically.
connections.title: Food portions must be smaller to reduce helath problems and left overs leading to waste. optimizes food consumption we must eat healthier, cheaper, more efficient food
